page.title: 11CONGRESBURY RIVER YEO
page.content: THE RIVER YEO MEANDERS ITS WAY THROUGH THE BLOCK ON ITS WAY FROM BLAGDON LAKE TO THE RIVER SEVERN. UPSTREAM FROM CONGRESBURY IF IS ONLY A STREAM, BUT WITH ITS NETWORK OF TRIBUTARY RHYNES, MANY OF THEM MAN-MADE DRAINAGE CHANNELS IT PROVIDES THE ESSENTIAL DRAINAGE FOR THE LOW- LYING LAND. AS IT IS THIS LAND IS OF POOR QUALITY AND LIABLE TO FLOOD; AS A RESULT IT IS USED EXCLUSIVELY AS PASTURE. AT IWOOD IS AN INTERESTING TWO-ARCHED STONE BRIDGE OPVER THE RIVER WITH A WEIR A SHORT DISTANCE UPSTREAM. IN WRINGTON THE RIVER IS HARDLY NOTICEABLE. TO THE SOUTH OF THE VILLAGE ON THE RIVER IS THE INTERESTINGLY NAMED BEAM MILL.
